      • simulateFailure

        public void simulateFailure(boolean fail)
        Simulates a failure by causing the node to not respond. If not implemented, will throw an UnsupportedOperation exception.
        Specified by:
        simulateFailure in interface IServerProtocol
        Parameters:
        fail - True, to simulate failure, False, to restore the unit to responsiveness.

                  Set<UUID> streams,

           throws OverwriteException,
                  TrimmedException,
                  NetworkException,
                  OutOfSpaceException
        Write to the stream unit.
        Specified by:
        write in interface IWriteOnceLogUnit
        Parameters:
        address - The address to write to
        payload - The payload to be written
        Throws:
        OverwriteException - If the address has already been written to.
        TrimmedException - If the address has been trimmed.
        NetworkException - If there is a network problem (not thrown by memory implementation).
        OutOfSpaceException

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        address - The address to read from.
        Returns:
        The data at that address.
        Throws:
        UnwrittenException - If there is no data at that address.
        TrimmedException - If the address has been trimmed.
        NetworkException - If there is a network problem (not thrown by memory implementation).
